item.title: World of Warcraft Addresses Midnight Pet Battle Controversy
item.description:
World of Warcraft has clarified that there will be new pet battle content in Midnight , despite its current absence in alpha, though some of these features will undergo iterations based on player reception and feedback. The future of pet battling in World of Warcraft is still unclear, but it seems Blizzard is not fully leaving this system behind just yet.

Several pieces of evidence that the pet battle system in World of Warcraft was being phased out appeared during the first build of the Midnight alpha. Pets in the open world, now classified as “Wild Pets” instead of “Battle Pets,” are caught with the single click of a button and have no battle statistics, and comments from game director Ion Hazzikostas suggested attention was being pulled away from the pet battle system due to lack of engagement, leading fans of the feature to fear for its future.

The State of Pet Battles in World of Warcraft: Midnight

Now, Blizzard has shared some clarification on this controversy. In a forum post by WoW community manager Kaivax, Blizzard confirmed the pet battle system was “being iterated on” in Midnight , and that the process would continue through later Alpha builds. He also stated four goals for pet battles World of Warcraft was currently shooting for while playtesting this system:

  • "For players who love collecting pets, there should be significant numbers of pets to collect.
  • For players who love to do pet battle combat, that will be available.
    • As time has passed, we’ve seen fewer and fewer players enjoying pet battle combat, so this is an area we want to iterate on.

  • There will be some new pets in Midnight that are capable of battling.
  • All parts of the pet battle system that were implemented in previous expansions should continue to operate as they have before."

These goals confirm a few things about pets in Midnight : players will still be able to collect pets, engage in pet battles, and collect new pets capable of battling. However, they don’t say what percentage of pets will be incapable of fighting or how much new battle content will be available, all while proving the pet battle system is in Blizzard’s sights due to low engagement. That said, it is keeping fan feedback in mind while making these changes, so World of Warcraft pet battle enthusiasts should continue to make their opinions known if they wish to see the system stay in Midnight and beyond.

Of course, it is important to remember that World of Warcraft: Midnight is still in its alpha period. Things are still subject to change in later builds, and it is possible that feedback could lead Blizzard to implement content like wild pet battles in Midnight before full release, possibly even with a fresh coat of paint. Either way, though existing pet battle content will continue to function regardless of what happens, it seems likely that pet collection and battling will look quite different in Midnight .

While some fans have suggested these changes are being made due to Nintendo’s recent Pokemon patent, the more likely reasoning is because of WoW ’s expedited release cadence. With less than two years between each expansion, it makes sense that Blizzard would seek to focus on parts of the game that people are invested in with the development time they have. Hopefully, whatever changes end up sticking for systems like pet battles will be satisfying for fans of the features.

World of Warcraft: Midnight

item.title: Mina the Hollower Hit With Release Date Delay
item.description:
Yacht Club Games has announced that Mina the Hollower will not arrive on Halloween as initially planned, as the game's release has been delayed to an undetermined date. The developer added that the extra time will be utilized to give Mina the Hollower some extra balance adjustments and tuning before committing to a definitive release date.

Mina the Hollower is the next project by Yacht Club Games, the creators of the game-changing indie title Shovel Knight and its spin-offs. Unlike Shovel Knight , Mina the Hollower utilizes an isometric perspective similar to classic Zelda games . This perspective is combined with the popular Soulslike genre as the basis for Mina the Hollower 's gameplay and difficulty. The game's titular character, an anthropomorphic mouse named Mina, is tasked with exploring Tenebrous Isle and defeating hordes of horrific enemies. Mina the Hollower was initially revealed as a Kickstarter project in 2022 and raised over $1,400,000.

Mina the Hollower Is Delayed

Although Mina the Hollower was initially stated to launch on Halloween on multiple platforms, that will no longer be the case. Yacht Club Games confirmed that Mina the Hollower has been delayed from its October 31 release date, but reassured fans that the game's development is close to being done. The announcement came over three weeks before Mina the Hollower was set to launch on multiple platforms. Yacht Club Games clarified that the delay was not a major one and that the extra time would be utilized to apply some finishing touches. The developer said that it would not announce another release date for Mina the Hollower until the game had been submitted to digital storefronts and asked fans for their patience.

Yacht Club Games stated that the last things that are being developed for Mina the Hollower include finalizing its audio and visual designs, tuning the game's balancing, and implementing localizations in different languages. Additional rounds of game testing and bug fixing will also be conducted on all platforms that Mina the Hollower is stated to launch on, including current and last-gen platforms. A limited-time demo for Mina the Hollower was released on various platforms in June 2025, which gave prospective players a way to test out the game and provide feedback.

With indie titles like Hollow Knight: Silksong and Hades 2 proving successful, the delayed launch of Mina the Hollower could be beneficial for Yacht Club Games in the long run. It remains to be seen how much player feedback will be applied to Mina the Hollower once it is fully released.

Mina the Hollower

item.title: Digimon Story Time Stranger How To Fuse Digimon
item.description:
In Digimon Story: Time Stranger , there are various ways to Fuse and evolve your Digimon that involve merging various of your Partners into a more powerful version. However, since the game has over 400 Digimon to befriend and train, knowing which are available for fusions and cross-evolution can be tricky.

Plus, with so many different types of Digivolutions (including DNA/Jogress ), players will be wasting lots of time with trial and error. So, in this guide, they will find all the information regarding the different types of Fusions, DNA Evolutions, and how to distinguish them. This also includes the Fusion Enhancement guide, so that players know what this feature is about.

What is DNA Digivolution (or Jogress Evolution) in Digimon Story: Time Stranger?

The term DNA Digivolution , also known as Jogress , is a fusion between two Digimon that can be Permanent or Temporary, meaning that it happens during Combat and lasts for only one turn, consuming the turn of both Digimon involved but launching a powerful attack. The Temporary version of the DNA Digivolution is somewhat a hidden feature in the game, which players will only learn about by trial and error.

Some Digimon that are enabled for DNA Digivolution will have some strange symbols in their skills , meaning they can lead the DNA Digivolution during combat by picking one of the secret techniques that become unlocked once their Jogress partner is present in the same team. The only requisite for this is that they must be compatible, and they must be both on the Active Party and not in the Reserve.

Now, for the Permanent Jogress Evolution, two Digimon become one through the Divivolution Feature, and they both merge into one. Resetting to level 1, but becoming permanently bound as a single individual. These powerful Jogress Evolutions are, for example: Omnimon (WarGreymon+MetalGarurumon), Examon (Slayerdramon+Brekdramon), and Mastemon (Angewomon+LadyDevimon). But there are many other Jogress available in the game, so players need to be keen as to which Digimon they train, so that they can reach the end game having at least one of these Jogress Evolutions available.

All Jogress Evolutions in Digimon Story: Time Stranger

Digimon Story: Time Stranger has a ton of different evolution types, and Jogress are the strongest of them all, with Digimon overcoming the limits of the Mega level even more than with the Burst Mode or Armor Digievolution. Each Jogress evolution in the game has certain requirements, and most of them depend on the personality type of their Digimon. Shifting each of the needed Digimon into a specific Personality can be burdensome, but players can also use methods like the DigiFarm to speed up the process.

The following is a list of all Jogress Evolutions in Digimon Story: Time Stranger, and it includes the prerequisites for them to be activated in combat (Single Turn) or permanently through the Digivolution feature:

Jogress

Digimon Needed

Requirements for Combat Jogress

Requirements for Permanent Jogress

Examon

Slayerdramon + Breakdramon (Both from the Dracomon Evolution line)

Agent Rank 7+ Slayerdramon + Breakdramon in Party

Agent Rank 8+ Slayerdramon (Daring) Breakdramon (Reckless)

Alphamon Ooryuken

Alphamon (Dorumon) + Ooryumon (Ryudamon)

Agent Rank 7+ Alphamon + Ooryumon in Party

Agent Rank 8+ Alphamon (Friendly) + Ooryumon (Zealous)

Mastemon

Angewomon + LadyDevimon

Agent Rank 6+ Angewomon + LadyDevimon in Party

Agent Rank 7+ Angewomon (Tolerant) + LadyDevimon (Enlightened)

Omnimon

MetalGarurumon + WarGreymon

Agent Rank 7+ MetalGarurumon + WarGreymon in Party

Agent Rank 8+ MetalGarurumon (Friendly) + WarGreymon (Daring)

Omnimon Zwart (Black Omnimon)

MetalGarurumon (Black) + WarGreymon (Black)

Agent Rank 7+ MetalGarurumon (Black) + BlackWargreymon in Party

Agent Rank 8+ MetalGarurumon (Black) (Friendly) + BlackWargreymon (Reckless)

Shakkoumon

Ankylomon + Angemon

Agent Rank 4+ Ankylomon + Angemon in Party

Agent Rank 5+ Ankylomon(Overprotective) + Angemon (Enlightened)

Paildramon

ExVeemon + Stingmon

Agent Rank 4+ ExVeemon + Stingmon in Party

Agent Rank 5+ ExVeemon (Zealous) + Stingmon (Tolerant)

Dinobeemon

Stingmon + ExVeemon

Agent Rank 4+ ExVeemon + Stingmon in Party

Agent Rank 5+ ExVeemon (Zealous) + Stingmon (Tolerant)

Silphymon

Gatomon + Aquilamon

Agent Rank 4 + Gatomon + Aquilamon in Party

Agent Rank 5 Gatomon (Tolerant) + Aquilamon (Sociable)

Chaosmon

Darkdramon + BanchoLeomon

Agent Rank 7+ Darkdramon + BanchoLeomon in Party

Agent Rank 8+ Darkdramon (Zealous) + BanchoLeomon (Daring)

Millenniummon

Machinedramon + Kimeramon

Agent Rank 6+ Machinedramon + Kimeramon in Party

Agent Rank 7+ Machinedramon (Reckless) + Kimeramon (Friendly)

Susanomon

EmperorGreymon + MagnaGarurumon

Agent Rank 7+ EmperorGreymon + MagnaGarurumon in Party

Agent Rank 8+ EmperorGreymon (Zealous) + MagnaGarurumon (Friendly)

Chaosmon Valdur Arm

BanchoLeomon + Varodurumon

Agent Rank 7+ BanchoLeomon + Varodurumon in Party

Agent Rank 8+ BanchoLeomon (Daring) + Varodurumon (Sociable)

GraceNovamon

Apollomon + Dianamon

Agent Rank7 + Apollomon + Dianamon in Party

Agent Rank 8+ Apollomon (Daring) + Dianamon (Enlightened)

Remember to check the list of Digimon in the box frequently, as some of these cannot be obtained later on the adventure, and players can get locked out of some evolution lines and Jogress options due to this. De-volving Digimon until reaching one of the In-Training Digimon required to reach other evolution lines is always an option, so take that into consideration as well.

There are some Jogress Digimon that are currently unavailable in the game, like Apocalymon , that can be obtained by evolving Piedmon or Puppetmon. This might be due to the requisites for this Jogress being to merge four Digimon (Piedmon+Puppetmon+Machinedramon+MetalSeadramon) into one. Same with the case of Fanglongmon (Fuanglongmon), which requires merging the four Divine Beast Digimon (Azulongmon, Byakkomon, Ebonwumon, and Zhuqiaomon), which are not present in Digimon Story: Time Stranger .

This list is under construction. Please be aware of incoming changes as new information is found about the available Jogress Evolutions in Digimon Story: Time Stranger.

What is Digimon Fusion (Enhancement) in Digimon Story: Time Stranger

Digimon Fusion or Enhancement Loading is a way to merge several Digimon to reinforce a single one. The Talent a Digimon has is the level cap that Digimon is going to reach. By Fusing various spare Digimon with the one players want to reinforce, it will gain strength, stats, level, and raise its Talent/Level Cap. That way, players can take their Partner Digimon to the highest levels of power, most of them required for the most powerful evolutions in the game. To use the Load Enhancement feature, follow these steps:

  1. Open the Digivice Menu (X on Pc, Triangle on PS, Y on Xbox).
  2. Rotate to the Digimon Tab and select it.
  3. Scroll down to 'Load Enhancement.'
  4. Select the Digimon to reinforce.
  5. Now, in the new menu, select the Digimon used as 'sacrifice.'
  6. The selected Digimon will be lost, and the first Digimon will be reinforced.

The maximum level Cap is 99 per Stage, meaning that if players take a Digimon to level 99 Stage by Stage, they will probably get a more powerful version of said Digimon each time they evolve it. Some Digimon have higher innate talent than others; even the same Digimon can have varying Talent levels .

Now, the higher a Stage is for a Digimon, and the higher its Level/Talent is, the more power it will grant to the core Digimon players want to reinforce. For example: Two in-training Digimon at Level 1 will grant less Exp and Talent than a Rookie at Level 1. Champion and Ultimate Digimon used to fuse with a lower Stage Digimon will also bring more benefits than merging lower stage Digimon into a higher stage one.

Some Digimon are easier to get ( farming Data ) than others, so it is highly recommended that players fill their box with a steady amount of spare Digimon to perform Enhancement in the later stages of the game.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Persona Has Been Beaten By a New Turn-Based RPG
item.description:
Atlus' Persona franchise is one of the most popular in the history of JRPGs, but its Steam player count numbers have been blown away by the recently-released Digimon Story: Time Stranger . Digimon Story: Time Stranger launched last week to mostly positive reviews and has proven to be a big hit for the franchise. In fact, it's quickly becoming one of the most popular Digimon video games ever made.

Digimon Story: Time Stranger is a turn-based RPG where players collect, train, and evolve their own team of Digimon. It features a time-bending narrative, plenty of references to the classic anime series, and a lot of content for franchise fans to sink their teeth into. The game has proven to be a big hit perhaps even beyond what many anticipated, becoming one of the most popular JRPGs in the history of Steam.

Digimon Story: Time Stranger Player Count Compared to Persona 5

As pointed out by GamesRadar, Digimon Story: Time Stranger 's player count numbers on Steam have even trounced some of the genre's heaviest hitters, like Persona and Final Fantasy . Digimon Story: Time Stranger 's peak concurrent player count on Steam is 84,458 at the time of this writing. For comparison, Persona 5 Royal 's peak concurrent player count on Steam was just 35,298. According to GamesRadar, the only two JRPGs that have been bigger on Steam are Metaphor: ReFantazio with its 85,961 concurrent players and Granblue Fantasy: Relink with its 114,054 concurrent players.

Clearly, Digimon Story: Time Stranger is popular, and its success will hopefully mean more Digimon games with even bigger budgets are released in the future. However, there is one major caveat to consider. Persona 5 didn't come to Steam until six years after it was first released on PS3 and PS4. It's safe to say that the majority of Persona fans had likely already played the game on one of those platforms, which could explain why its Steam concurrent player count is low compared to Digimon Story: Time Stranger , but why Time Stranger 's player count is lower than fellow Atlus RPG Metaphor: ReFantazio .

Whenever Persona 6 finally releases to the masses, if it's available on Steam day-and-date as other platforms, chances are it will beat Digimon Story: Time Stranger , but that remains to be seen. Word of mouth for Digimon Story: Time Stranger has proven to be quite strong, and it seems like the game is getting the attention of longtime franchise fans and newcomers alike. One has to wonder how it's performing on consoles, but hopefully more concrete sales information becomes available sooner rather than later.

10 /10

Digimon Story: Time Stranger

item.title: Grow a Garden: Best Pets Tier List
item.description:
With Roblox 's Grow a Garden animal update, the devs have really stepped up the game by adding a ton of fun new content. Now, besides growing fruits and taking care of your garden, you can also have some pets, just like Pet Simulator 99 . These animals aren't just a cute addition to your farm; they also boost your crops and improve your player experience in some pretty cool ways.

Some pets will make your fruits and veggies mutate, while others will make them bigger or even give you free fruits and seeds. To get them, though, you’ll need to buy and hatch their eggs, which can cost a lot of Sheckles. So, it’s important to know which animals are worth it. If you’re looking to spend wisely, here's a ranking of the animals in Grow a Garden from least to most valuable .

Updated on October 6, 2025, by Somiya Adrees: The tier list below in this guide has been refreshed to include every pet available up to the 1.26.0 update, including all the time-limited pets as well; this should help players decide which pets to keep, trade, or let go.

Grow a Garden: All Pets Tier List

Currently, Grow a Garden is home to 165 animals, each with its own unique abilities. Think of them as walking gear. They can do stuff like turn your crops into mutated ones, water your plants, speed up sprinklers, or even search out free seeds for you.

You can only have three animals active in your garden at a time (unless you've snagged more pet slots), but the good news is that any extras you hatch won’t go to waste. You can swap them in and out whenever you like for a fresh vibe or to enjoy their different perks. Here’s a simple tier list of all the animals in Grow a Garden , with reasons why some are more useful than others:

All Animals

Tier Ranking

Type

Reasoning

Kitsune

S Tier

Fruit-Stealing Pet

Right now, the best pet in Grow a Garden. It can apply a Chakra Mutation (15x value) to a fruit from a nearby garden , or even a Foxfire Chakra (90x value), and give it to you.

Raccoon

S Tier

Fruit-Stealing Pet

Gives free fruit every 15 minutes by cloning one from a neighbor’s garden .

Disco Bee

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Activates the Disco mutation on crops (125x value) nearly every 20 minutes, with a 12.28% chance each time.

Cockatrice

S Tier

Multiple Traits

A multi-talented critter that adds Gold and Silver variants to your plants. It can also do one of three things at a time: hatch eggs faster, give crops Toxic Mutation (15x), or help pets earn more Experience Points.

Dragonfly

S Tier

Variant Pet

Gives a guaranteed Gold plant every five minutes (worth 20x more). It's hard to say no to that.

Corrupted Kitsune

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Turns nine fruits in your garden into either Corrupt Chakra (15x value) or Corrupt Foxfire Chakra (90x value) variants.

Chinchilla

S Tier

Ability Cloner

Better than the Mimic Octopus, as it lets the critter perform another pet’s ability three times within 40 minutes (saves 20 minutes compared to the Mimic Octopus).

Mimic Octopus

S Tier

Ability Cloner

Mimics the ability of an active pet . Best when paired with other S-tier animals.

Swan

S Tier

Ability Cloner & Mutation Pet

Works like the Mimic Octopus but copies a pet ability from a neighbor’s farm. Also applies the Graceful Mutation to plants.

Butterfly

S Tier

Variant Pet

Applies Rainbow mutation (50x) to plants with five mutations every 30 minutes (skips favorited ones).

French Fry Ferret

S Tier

Aging Pet

Best critter for aging pets, as it grants 1 level to a random pet every 20 minutes to an hour. Great for farming pet age to trigger mutations.

Space Squirrel

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Forces the previously admin-special Voidtouched Mutation (135x multiplier) onto your plants.

Spinosaurus

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Eats one mutation from four plants and puts them all on a single fruit , preferring to bless one of your favorited plants.

T-Rex

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Eats a mutation from a random fruit grown on your farmland and then pours it onto three to four different fruits .

Fennec Fox

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Copies the most valuable mutation from a plant in your neighbor's garden and applies it to one of your crops.

Brontosaurus

S Tier

Size Booster

It’s the first animal that can give you big pets by adding a size and weight bonus to hatched eggs.

Lemon Lion

S Tier

Mutation Pet & XP Booster

Forces Brainrot Mutation (100x) on fruits and adds XP to a random pet’s bar.

Golden Goose

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Lays a Golden Egg, which is actually a plant with the Fortune Mutation (50x multiplier). Selling this egg-like crop might pass the Fortune Mutation to one of the fruits in your garden.

Griffin

S Tier

Mutation Pet & Cooldown Pet

Comes with two abilities: triggers Cyclonic mutation (50x) and shortens pet cooldowns by 67 seconds on contact.

Luminous Sprite

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Lets you obtain Luminous mutated fruits worth 50x.

Seal

S Tier

Egg Giver

Can give you the egg of a pet you just sold , meaning you can keep selling unwanted Mythicals and Divines for Mythical and Bug Eggs to try for your desired pets.

Queen Bee

S Tier

Cooldown & Mutation

Great as a support critter for Raccoon, Red Fox, Disco Bee, and more, since it fully resets a random pet’s ability cooldown . Also applies the Pollinated mutation (3x value) to a nearby crop roughly every 25 minutes.

Red Fox

S Tier

Seed Pet

Steals (duplicates) a plant seed from a neighbor’s farm (Seed Shop ones only).

Chicken Zombie

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Grants your fruits the Zombified Mutation (25x multiplier).

Blood Kiwi

S Tier

Hatch Related

Can greatly reduce your eggs' hatch time (by 45 seconds per minute) and increase hatch speed by 20%.

Praying Mantis

S Tier

Variant Pet

Triggers either a Gold or Rainbow mutation on fruits, boosting their value. Definitely a must-have if you're aiming for higher stacking bonuses.

Lobster Thermidor

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Applies Molten (25x value) or the admin-special Meteoric (125x) mutation to a plant in your garden.

Pancake Mole

S Tier

Resource Pet

Can find Sheckles, all types of Sprinklers (including Mater and Grandmaster ), Trowel, Recall Wrench, Harvest Tool, Lightning Rod, and Watering Can.

Shiba Inu

S Tier

Seed Pet

More chance to dig up a seed than Golden Lab. Improve its ability by using Nihonzaru or giving it Gold or Rainbow pet mutations.

Blood Owl

S Tier

XP Booster

Makes all your active pets age faster .

Firefly

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Turns nearby plants Shocked (100x multiplier) every 80 seconds, with a 3% chance.

Chubby Chipmunk

S Tier

Aging & Resource Pet

Gains weight over time and also rewards you with exclusive Chubby Chipmunk Event items. Pretty OP for the event!

Idol Chipmunk

A Tier

XP Booster

Fills 1.48% of all pets’ hunger bars per second every 12 minutes (the percentage increases as the chipmunk ages). It’s extremely good for keeping critters fed .

Tiger

A Tier

Multiple Traits

Grants 5,186 total XP to all critters on your farm and swaps three random mutations for three new ones in your garden.

Fortune Squirrel

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Forces the admin-reserved Jackpot mutation to plants with a 15x multiplier.

Red Panda

A Tier

Restock Pet

Can go to either the Gear Shop, Seed Shop, or Pet Shop to restock one random item. This critter's ability can't be mimicked.

Sugar Glider

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Unlike Spinosaurus, which consumes the mutations from plants, this one just copies mutations from three plants and applies them to each other.

Marmot

A Tier

Resource Pet

Plays hide and seek with you, rewarding Fall-type items if caught. It also has a 15 to 30% chance of doing it again.

Phoenix

A Tier

Multiple Traits

When pets are processed in the mutation machine, they come out aged up to 4 years. Additionally, the critter grants a 20% chance to apply Flaming Mutation (25x) to four fruits in your garden.

Dilophosaurus

A Tier

XP Booster

Gives 608 XP to 3 to 4 random pets so they age quicker or use their traits a bit sooner (like 41 seconds early).

Peach Wasp

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Adds the once admin-only Plasma Mutation to fruits and pushes forward a random pet’s cooldown.

Mole

A Tier

Resource Pet

Can dig up free gear for you every 80 seconds (i.e., Sprinklers, Lightning Rod, Trowel) and also Sheckles.

Apple Gazelle

A Tier

Multiple Traits

Applies Warped Mutation (75x) to apple-type fruits when picked up and also duplicates them .

Sand Snake

A Tier

Resource Pet

Clone tools from the Gear Shop (like Sprinklers, Tanning Mirrors, Magnifying Glass, and more) and seeds from the Seed Shop when making a purchase, meaning you might get two instead of one with a 1.45% chance.

Axolotl

A Tier

Harvest Related

Best for making Sheckles, as it gives you a 6.54% chance for summer fruits to stay on their plants . Most of those are top-tier, like Traveler’s Fruit, Lily of the Valley, and Guanabana, so you can collect more of them when harvesting.

Petal Bee

A Tier

Multiple Traits

Ideal for farming Pollinated Fruits (Queen Bee-like timer) and keeping flowers after harvest , especially high-value ones like Sunflower, Moon Blossom, Purple Dahlia, and Pink Lily.

Pachycephalosaurus

A Tier

Resource Pet

When crafting items, it may grant you a bonus item of the same kind.

Triceratops

A Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Literally the best pet to use if you want multiple plants to grow fruits quickly .

Tanchozuru

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Adds the Tranquil mutation (20x value) to all crop types in your garden.

Cooked Owl

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Can give your crops the Burnt (4x value) or Cooked (25x value) mutation roughly every 15 minutes, with a 15.28% chance to activate. Also grants active animals an extra 0.17 experience points.

Sushi Bear

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Offers better odds of triggering Frozen (10x value) or Chilled (2x value) mutations than a Polar Bear (15%) and can also feed pets to keep them full.

Raiju

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Removes the Shocked mutation from a fruit and applies the Static (8x value) mutation to four fruits in your garden. During thunderstorms, it may apply the Shocked mutation instead of Static. Favorited fruits are ignored.

Spaghetti Sloth

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Blesses plants with either Sauce (3x value), Meatball (3x value), or Pasta (4x value) every 3 to 14 minutes. Combining all three grants the Spaghetti (15x value) mutation.

Spriggan

A Tier

Mutation Pet

This critter has a 15.21% chance to apply the Bloom mutation (8x value) to nearby plants.

Sea Turtle

A Tier

Mutation & XP Booster

Sends about 1,000 XP to a random pet every 11 minutes and makes a fruit Wet (2x value).

Tree Frog

A Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Like Triceratops, it speeds up a plant’s growth every three minutes for a total of 15 minutes.

Moon Cat

A Tier

Plant Growth & Harvest Related

Boosts fruit size (1.51x) and keeps Lunar and Blood Moon plants from disappearing after harvest (with only a 6.1% chance).

Ostrich

A Tier

Aging Pet

Lets your hatched pets come with an age of one to four.

Blood Hedgehog

A Tier

Plant Growth & Variant

Best if you have lots of prickly fruits (i.e., Durian, Cactus, Dragon Fruit, and Pineapple) on your farm, as this critter can make them larger and increase their chances of getting Gold and Rainbow variants.

Tarantula Hawk

A Tier

Cooldown & Mutation

Similar to Queen Bee , but only advances pet cooldown by 1.3 minutes. Useful if you haven’t unlocked Queen Bee yet.

Starfish

A Tier

XP Booster

A situational critter that gains 6.36 XP every second . Best used when you're trying to unlock extra pet slots. It's even better than any Brown Mouse, as it can earn you 3,816 experience points every 10 minutes.

Koi

A Tier

Egg Giver

May return the eggs you hatch while they’re swimming around your plot.

Golden Lab

A Tier

Seed Pet

Digs up random seeds ( Common to Prismatic) . Perfect for farming while you're AFK.

Capybara

A Tier

XP Booster

Critters within its radar won’t lose hunger and will gain XP every second instead.

Snail

A Tier

Seed Pet

Can sometimes give you a seed from the plant you just harvested .

Turtle

A Tier

Sprinkler Pet

Mainly works with sprinklers, making them last longer .

Night Owl

A Tier

XP Booster

Has the same ability as Blood Owl but isn’t as good.

Echo Frog

A Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Speeds up a random plant’s growth by a full day every 10 minutes.

Hamster

A Tier

Speed-Up Pet

Handy for crafting, as it boosts your crafting speed by 30.45% for 18.74 seconds every 3.05 minutes.

Mizuchi

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Grants Azure mutation to plants. When you sell those plants, there’s a chance a random mutation from the fruit will reapply to another plant.

Silver Dragonfly

B Tier

Variant Pet

Adds a Silver mutation (variant) to plants, but it’s weaker compared to Dragonfly or Butterfly since its multiplier is the lowest.

Hyrax

B Tier

Seed Pet

Gives you a rare Fissure Berry seed (worth 13k shekels per berry) by eating around your garden.

Hummingbird

B Tier

Seed Pet

Converts single-harvest plants into seeds every minute (including some limited seeds), except for favorited ones.

Mallard

B Tier

Resource Pet

Gifts the player with a random gear item and then returns to the player's inventory.

Barn Owl

B Tier

XP and Pet Size

All pets from the Fall update earn extra XP per second while roaming your farm if the Barn Owl is active. It also gives a weight bonus to pets bought from the shops.

Chipmunk

B Tier

Resource Pet

Has a small chance to not consume one of the Harvest Tool’s uses, which is really useful.

Red Squirrel

B Tier

Cooldown Pet

Makes Fall-type pets use their abilities quicker.

Imp

B Tier

Resource Pet

Plays a catch game with you, and if you grab it, you get rewards like gear and event items . Sometimes it even gives you Grandmaster Sprinklers.

Wisp

B Tier

XP Booster

Allows all active pets in your garden to 0.77 gain experience points per second , but only if a Wisp Well is placed.

Golem

B Tier

Speed-Up Pet

If you’re mutating a pet, it goes to the Mutation Machine every 6.35 minutes and cuts its timer by 42.42 seconds.

Drake

B Tier

Speed-Up Pet

Cuts cooking time by 11% as it breathes fire beneath the pot.

Ankylosaurus

B Tier

Resource Pet

Might return stolen plants to your inventory while it’s active.

Tanuki

B Tier

Multiple Traits

Messes around in your garden by adding mutations like Choc (2x), Chilled (2x), Moonlit (2x) and more to one of your fruits; it may also grant Sheckles , age itself, or do other activities.

Bald Eagle

B Tier

Hatch Related

Lets you hatch eggs 70.40 seconds faster every 7 minutes, not as good as Blood Kiwi, though.

Gnome

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Applies the Gnomed Mutation (15x) and adds a 1.05% extra chance to force it if Gnomed-type cosmetics are placed in your plot.

Junkbot

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Forces the Oil mutation (15x multiplier) on a random plant (14.52% chance).

Mandrake

B Tier

Mutation Pet

While active in your garden, there is a 3% chance to apply Rot Mutation (8x) to a random fruit.

Grizzly Bear

B Tier

Mutation and Player Size Pet

It forces Fall Mutation on plants. Also, makes your avatar bigger , which looks pretty fun.

Gorilla Chef

B Tier

Cooking Pet

It has a good chance of giving you two meals instead of one when cooking.

Hyacinth Macaw

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Like the Cloudtouched Mutation Spray, it gives your crops the Cloudtouched Mutation (6x multiplier) every eight minutes, though the probability is only 15.74%.

Bear Bee

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Acts just like a Honey Sprinkler, granting a confirmed HoneyGlazed mutation (5x value) to fruits every 25 minutes.

Badger

B Tier

Mutation Pet

The first critter that lets you trigger the Cracked Mutation (4x) even outside Earthquake weather.

Polar Bear

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Has a 10.12% chance to grant you a Chilled or Frozen fruit every 1.49 minutes.

Pterodactyl

B Tier

Jump Height & Mutation

Increases your character’s jump height and flaps its wings to give three to four fruits the Windstruck Mutation (2x Value), and sometimes even the Twisted Mutation (5x Value).

Scarlet Macaw

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Has a chance to bless a nearby fruit with a Verdant mutation (4x value) every 11.51 minutes, though the chance is only 15.95%.

Red Giant Ant

B Tier

Harvest Related

Can copy your plants when you pick them (even Divine ones).

Bacon Pig

B Tier

Variant Pet

Same as the Pig, it raises the odds of nearby plants growing as Gold or Rainbow variants , though it takes a bit longer to activate in comparison.

Kiwi

B Tier

Hatch Related

A weaker version of Blood Kiwi (helps lower hatching time to 20 seconds per minute).

Sunny-Side Chicken

B Tier

Hatch Related

Useful for hatching, as it increases hatch speed by 20.27%.

Silver Monkey

B Tier

Resource Pet

When you sell fruit, it might pop back into your inventory (even mutated ones like Shocked, Gold, or Rainbow). The rarer it is, the lower the chance.

Football

B Tier

Resource Pet

You can get Sheckles or a Watering Can by running around the related shops.

Kappa

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Waters your plants to give them the Wet mutation (2x value), or alternatively transforms Wet fruits into Bloodlit (5x value).

Spotted Deer

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

Can duplicate your berry plants (Celestiberries, Grapes, Strawberries, Blueberries, Cranberries) with a 5% chance.

Blue Jay

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Makes berry plants grow 1.55x faster , which is especially useful during events that require submitting berry crops.

Farmer Chipmunk

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Speeds up the growth of nutty plants such as Acorn, Hazelnut, Acorn Squash, and Coconut, making them mature 1.56x faster.

Deer

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

A variant of the Spotted Deer with lower odds of cloning berry plants , but still handy in the Fall Update.

Parasaurolophus

B Tier

Speed-Up Pet

Mostly helps you open up the cosmetic crates faster.

Raptor

B Tier

Mutation Pet and Movement Booster

Has a small chance to trigger the Amber Mutation (10x value) on harvested fruits and also boosts walking speed by 14%.

Seedling

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Lets you swap mutations between two plants , so you can farm mutations on your best ones. Thankfully, it ignores favorited plants.

Stegosaurus

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

Lets you snag a bonus fruit when picking plants . Prehistoric crops have better odds than other rare ones. It’s super useful when harvesting a Bone Blossom plant.

Moth

B Tier

Aging Pet

Keeps your pets' Hunger Bar full every 13 minutes, helping them age faster and perform better (Variant pets can give higher-tier mutations, and seed diggers can find better seeds.)

Honey Bee

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Lets you farm guaranteed Pollinated plants (3x multiplier) faster than other bees. Aging it can reduce the timer.

Mochi Mouse

B Tier

XP Booster

Can grant 510 XP to itself and a small amount of XP per second to food-type critters like French Fry Ferret, Spaghetti Sloth, Sushi Beet, etc.

B Tier

Cooldown and XP Booster

Can give experience points or advance a pet’s cooldown every 3.57 minutes with a 20% chance.

Meerkat

B Tier

Cooldown Pet

A critter that can lower another pet’s cooldown by 21.08 seconds every 7.14 minutes. Sometimes, it might even perform its ability again instantly after one round.

Pig

B Tier

Variant Pet

Has a higher chance of granting Gold and Rainbow variants than the Praying Mantis (2.2% every two minutes), but its cooldown is longer in comparison. It’s a decent pick, though not as rewarding as the Mantis.

Giant Ant

B Tier

Harvest Related

Not as strong as Red Giant Ant , but it's still useful.

Dog

B Tier

Seed Pet

It’s like a low-key version of a Golden Lab.

Orangutan

B Tier

Resource Pet

It comes in handy when crafting often, as it offers a 3.43% chance to return materials to your backpack.

Crab

B Tier

Resource Pet

Only manages to snatch around 260 to 460 Sheckles every 6 minutes.

Brown Mouse

B Tier

Jump Height & XP Booster

Good for unlocking more pet slots since it ages fast (803.74 XP/10 min) and also boosts player jump height .

Panda

B Tier

Crop Value Booster

Bamboo is a solid money plant, and Panda increases its price even more.

Wasp

B Tier

Cooldown & Mutation

Shares the same abilities as Queen Bee and Tarantula Hawk, but has a weaker ability timer.

Dairy Cow

B Tier

Plant Growth & Seed Pet

Speeds up crop growth in a small range and can sometimes drop a Beanstalk seed when sold.

Sea Otter

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Owl

B Tier

XP Booster

Shares the same abilities as Blood Owl and Night Owl, but it's not that solid.

B Tier

Harvest Related

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Makes leafy plants grow faster (Beanstalk, Corn, Pepper, Eggplant, etc.), but there are other crops that aren’t leafy.

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Makes all magic-type plants (e.g., Fairy event plants) grow 1.6x faster.

Ladybug

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Speeds up all flower-type crops by 1.6x , making Tranquil Bloom, Moon Blossom, Poseidon Plant, and more grow faster than usual.

Cow

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Helps with plant growth, making it spawn fruits real quick (about 1.12 times faster).

Woodpecker

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Lets wood-type plants duplicate. Best used in events where these crops need to be submitted.

Elk

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

Berry fruits have a 2% chance to remain after harvest.

B Tier

Plant Growth & Mutation

Flamingo

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Good for overall plant and fruit growth, but not as effective as the Triceratops.

Robin

A playful new pet that shrinks your avatar’s height , giving it a cute look.

Crop Value Booster

Bunny

D Tier

Crop Value Booster

Just a regular bunny that eats carrots and bumps up their selling value by 1.5x.

Best Pets in Grow a Garden

Most animals in Grow a Garden are super helpful, but a few of them stand out from the pack:

  • Kitsuni has outshined all other fruit-stealing critters in Grow a Garden . It’s even better than Raccoon because not only can it steal a plant for you like Candy Blossom, but it also raises that plant’s value by 15x or even 90x before giving it to you.
  • Dragonfly and Butterfly are also OP critters since they give you the two most valuable variants in the game: Gold and Rainbow. These can blow up your plant's stacking bonus, taking their value from just a few million to literal billions.
  • Disco Bee and Space Squirrel can give you Disco and Voidtouched plants, which were once limited to rare Disco and Blackhole events. These mutated variants sell for 125x and 135x their original value.
  • Mimic Octopus and Swan are among the best critters in Grow a Garden since they can act as duplicate pets. The Octopus copies traits from your active pets, while the Swan copies from a neighbor’s farm.
  • Fennec Fox, T-Rex, and Spinosaurus are must-haves for mutations. One of the main differences is that the fox can steal mutations from neighboring farms (even Dawnbound, Plasma, and Voidtouched), while the dinosaurs can clone them from your own farm. Spinosaurus is especially useful when you want to stack mutations on your favorite fruits.
  • The top pets from the Chubby Chipmunk Event in Grow a Garden are obviously Chubby Chipmunk, Idol Chipmunk, and Fortune Squirrel. These pets help with event rewards, aging other pets and mutations.
